data.name: Testing the Porges hypothesis
data.description:
[Arthur Porges](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Porges) was mostly known to be a novelist, but he also wrote a small paper about the mathematical hypothesis stating that recursively summing the squares of the digits of any number will either end up to 1 or go on cyclically.

Your task is to write a simple function that tell return the first number of any cycle, `-1` otherwise:

```c
porges_cycle(1) == -1 // it stays 1, it is not considered a cycle
porges_cycle(2) ==  4 // the cycle starts with 4, then 16, then 37, then 58, etc going back to 4 in 8 moves
porges_cycle(4) ==  4 // same as above, just one less step
porges_cycle(7) == -1 // 7=>49=>97=>130=>10=>1, no cycle!
porges_cycle(9) == 37 // a cycle occurs, try to find it!

```
```javascript
porgesCycle(1) === -1 //it stays 1, it is not considered a cycle
porgesCycle(2) === 4  //the cycle starts with 4, then 16, then 37, then 58, etc going back to 4 in 8 moves
porgesCycle(4) === 4  //same as above, just one less step
porgesCycle(7) === -1 //7=>49=>97=>130=>10=>1, no cycle!
porgesCycle(9) === 37  //a cycle occurs, try to find it!

```
```cpp
porgesCycle(1) == -1 //it stays 1, it is not considered a cycle
porgesCycle(2) == 4  //the cycle starts with 4, then 16, then 37, then 58, etc going back to 4 in 8 moves
porgesCycle(4) == 4  //same as above, just one less step
porgesCycle(7) == -1 //7=>49=>97=>130=>10=>1, no cycle!
porgesCycle(9) == 37  //a cycle occurs, try to find it!

```

